persona.name: Richard
persona.activities: Richard spends about half of his time at his desk; the other half is spent on duty in the community. He works and interacts with technology at set times, and is prescribed by the policies and tools employed by his station. Although his working hours are pre-determined, the nature of shift work means he might work on different days, and different times of day. Being a policeman is a physically demanding, and the technology accompanying him can be "put through its paces". As a result, technology is prone to breakage or loss, and subsequent replacement.
persona.attitudes: Like many security professionals, Richard is conservative by nature; he prefers the "tried and tested" over the novel and unknown. As a figure of authority, he embraces authority, and serving the community gives him a high sense of self-worth and assertiveness. However, working with the less desirable aspects of society has also made Richard cynical and suspicious of outsiders. Consequently, Richard can be quick to jump to conclusions, an attribute he chalks up to experience, but others may see as prejudicial. Richard's pragmatism filters through to his attitude to technology: either it does the job or not; if it works he'll use it, if it doesn't he won't.
persona.aptitudes: To effectively perform his duties, Richard needs to be emotionally stable, and approaching any problems with a calm and rationale manner. Some of these duties are less glamorous than others, so a low boredom threshold helps. Working with the public on a day-to-day basis also requires a certain affinity with people, intuitively empathising when required and asserting his authority when needed.
persona.motivations: Like any professional, Richard wants to do well at his job, to get noticed and get the next promotions. On a day-to-day basis this means being efficient and effective. The technology that supports him does not have to be perfect, the UI does not have to be sleek; Richard will put up with a lot of "irritations" as long at the technology does the job effectively. Richard is burdened by the administration that plagues his working life. Anything that enables him to spend less time in the office and more time on the streets doing his job is a good thing.
persona.skills: Richard has acquired his skills through his training and professional development. The skills of organisation, memory and observation are base skills every policeman is grounded in and Richard has these in abundance. Richard tolerates routine, and understand and values the need for clear procedure in his daily habits. Richard is a fast decision maker and can follow this through with the public and his work colleague, demonstrating leadership.
